title: Determining First Quartile Value: Calories in Meat
question_text:
Examine the boxplots of calories below. Calories were measured per $3$ ounces of each type of meat.

Which type of meat has a first quartile value of $125 \text{ calories}$?
solution:
The first quartile is not measured at the center of the box; it is measured at the beginning of the first box. The first quartile is shown in red in the image below.

The first quartile for beef and other meat is somewhere near $140$, and poultry is near $105$.

Created for Albert.io. Copyright 2016. All rights reserved.



Therefore, none of the meats has a first quartile of $125$.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'E'.
